summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing preparation of a PowerPoint presentation for a mock jury exercise related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The emails focus on combining and anonymizing grand jury presentation materials, specifically to protect victim identities.

persons.name: Paralegal Specialist
persons.role: Paralegal Specialist at U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY
persons.context: Sent introductory email granting a contractor access to shared resources and outlining the PowerPoint task for the Maxwell case mock jury exercise.

connections.description: Both work at the U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY on the Maxwell case preparation, with the paralegal facilitating contractor access for M.

events.title: Contractor onboarding for Maxwell case
events.description: Paralegal Specialist emails M to inform that a contractor now has access to shared resources for the Maxwell case and outlines the PowerPoint task for a mock jury exercise.

events.title: PowerPoint preparation discussions
events.description: Multiple emails exchanged about combining Maxwell grand jury PowerPoints, replacing pictures, and planning to anonymize victim information for the mock jury exercise.

events.title: Finalization of anonymized materials
events.description: Emails discuss sending documents and creating an anonymized slide exhibit for the mock jury presentation, emphasizing the need to protect victim identities.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Paralegal office (location within the U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office SDNY was preparing a mock jury exercise for the Ghislaine Maxwell case as of September 2021.
Prosecutors were taking 'strong measures to protect victim identities' by anonymizing information in presentation materials.
The preparation involved combining grand jury presentation PowerPoints and a superseding indictment presentation.
The emails reveal internal workflow between attorneys, paralegals, and contractors on trial preparation tasks.
Specific instructions were given to create an anonymized slide exhibit, indicating careful handling of sensitive victim information.
